alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:51PM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Union NC County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 700 PM EST. * At 251 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. Watch for developing flash flooding along the Highway 74 corridor from the Mecklenburg County line through greater Monroe. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
